org.kramerlab.vines

Class RegularVine

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier
      • org.kramerlab.vines.RegularVine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, weka.classifiers.Classifier, weka.core.CapabilitiesHandler, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.RevisionHandler

    public class RegularVine
extends weka.classifiers.AbstractClassifier
    This class represents the Regular Vine.
    It is the main class of the vines package.
    It uses the Graph class to store the Graphs for its dimensions.
    It uses the Legend class to store the variable names for visualization.
    It can be used to perform sampling and classification.
    Actually the RVine is only implemented using Gauss copulae.
    The implementation is based on J.F. Dißmann's diploma thesis (2010): Statistical inference for regular vines and application.
    Author:
    Christian Lamberty (clamber@students.uni-mainz.de)
    See Also:

        public void buildClassifier(weka.core.Instances data)

        See the model selection algorithm presented in J.F. Dißmann's diploma thesis.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • createSample

        public double[] createSample(double[] x,
                             boolean[] given)
        Creates a sample instance.
        It can be used either for random sampling or for sampling specific entries only.
        x shall be a complete instance, where we can flag in the given array if we use the value of x for the new instance or if we re-sample the x value.
        Only the flagged as given values from x will affect the sampling. The other values will be overwritten with sampled values.
        The main part of the sampling approach is based on the sampling algorithm presented in J.F. Dißmann's diploma thesis.
        Parameters:
        x - an instance
        given - a boolean flag for each value of x if it shall be used as given value.
        Returns:
        returns the sampled instance.

      • createRandomSample

        public double[] createRandomSample()
        Creates a completely random sampled instance.
        It used the createSample-function with a default x-array, which are all flagged as not given.
        Returns:
        returns a random sampled instance.

      • logLikelihood

        public double logLikelihood(weka.core.Instance instance)
        The log-likelihood for a given instance.
        The method is based on an algorithm presented in J.F. Dißmann's diploma thesis.
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance.
        Returns:
        returns the log-likelihood for the instance.

      • logLikelihood

        public double logLikelihood(weka.core.Instances instances)
        The log-likelihood for a several instances.
        It calculates the sum of log-likelihoods of every instance using the log-likelihood function for single instances.
        Parameters:
        instances - the instances.
        Returns:
        returns the log-likelihood for the instances.
